creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Theatrical robe (for a Taoist immortal) of yellow satin embroidered with large scale design of peaches, bats in medallions, and floral sprays.  Collar-band, extending to waist, of embroidered white satin.  Cuffs and all-around border of black satin embroidered with running floral pattern.  Belt section, stitched at upper edge only, of embroidered black satin, and two narrow hanging panels of the same at each side of front opening.  Long, very wide sleeves, chiefly satin and couched stitch.  Lining of thin pink silk.  Note This robe reputed to have been worn by a Tibetan prince.
title: Theatrical Robe for a Taoist Immortal
